DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date that the subject ended/stopped taking the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Template Text
CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 3028746 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Case Report Form Completion Instructions
ReferenceDocuments.description: Record the date the concomitant [medication/treatment] was stopped using this format (DD-MON-YYYY). If the subject has not stopped taking the concomitant [medication/treatment] leave this field blank.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CMENDTC
ReferenceDocuments.description: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH END DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable CMENDTC in ISO 8601 format.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDASH Implementation Notes
ReferenceDocuments.description: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
